when_to_say: when greeting someone
example: नमस्ते, कैसे हो? (Namaste, kaise ho? - Hello, how are you?)

when_to_say: to express gratitude
example: धन्यवाद, आपकी मदद के लिए। (Dhanyavaad, aapki madad ke liye. - Thank you for your help.)

when_to_say: to make a polite request
example: कृपया बैठिए। (Kripya baithie. - Please sit down.)

when_to_say: to express agreement
example: हाँ, मैं तैयार हूँ। (Haan, main taiyaar hoon. - Yes, I am ready.)

when_to_say: to express disagreement
example: नहीं, मुझे नहीं पता। (Naheen, mujhe nahin pata. - No, I don't know.)

when_to_say: to express approval or understanding
example: अच्छा, चलिए चलते हैं। (Achcha, chaliye chalte hain. - Okay, let's go.)

when_to_say: to ask a question
example: क्या आपका नाम क्या है? (Kya aapka naam kya hai? - What is your name?)

when_to_say: to ask about manner or condition
example: आप कैसे हैं? (Aap kaise hain? - How are you?)

when_to_say: to ask for a reason
example: आप क्यों रो रहे हैं? (Kyoon ro rahe hain aap? - Why are you crying?)

when_to_say: to ask about place
example: आप कहाँ रहते हैं? (Kahaan rahte hain aap? - Where do you live?)

when_to_say: to ask about time
example: आप कब जा रहे हैं? (Kab ja rahe hain aap? - When are you going?)

when_to_say: to ask about quantity
example: आप कितना कमाते हैं? (Kitna kamate hain aap? - How much do you earn?)

when_to_say: to refer to oneself
example: मैं डॉक्टर हूँ। (Main doctor hoon. - I am a doctor.)

when_to_say: to address a friend or family member
example: तुम कहाँ जा रहे हो? (Tum kahaan ja rahe ho? - Where are you going?)

when_to_say: to address someone with respect
example: आपका नाम क्या है? (Aapka naam kya hai? - What is your name?)

when_to_say: to refer to a third person
example: वह डॉक्टर है। (Vah doctor hai. - He/She is a doctor.)

when_to_say: to refer to a group of people
example: वे डॉक्टर हैं। (Ve doctor hain. - They are doctors.)

when_to_say: to point to something nearby
example: यह किताब अच्छी है। (Yah kitab achchi hai. - This book is good.)

when_to_say: to point to something far away
example: वह घर बड़ा है। (Vah ghar bada hai. - That house is big.)

when_to_say: to refer to a place of residence
example: मेरा घर बड़ा है। (Mera ghar bada hai. - My house is big.)

when_to_say: to refer to an educational institution
example: मैं स्कूल जाता हूँ। (Main skul jaata hoon. - I go to school.)

when_to_say: to refer to a place where goods are sold
example: मैं दुकान जाता हूँ। (Main dukaan jaata hoon. - I go to the shop.)

when_to_say: to refer to a place where goods are bought and sold
example: हम बाज़ार जाते हैं। (Ham bazaar jaate hain. - We go to the market.)

when_to_say: to refer to something that is eaten
example: मुझे खाना पसंद है। (Mujhe khana pasand hai. - I like food.)

when_to_say: to refer to a liquid substance
example: मुझे पानी पीना पसंद है। (Mujhe paani peena pasand hai. - I like to drink water.)

when_to_say: to refer to a white liquid produced by mammals
example: मैं दूध पीता हूँ। (Main doodh peeta hoon. - I drink milk.)

when_to_say: to refer to a hot beverage
example: मुझे चाय पसंद है। (Mujhe chai pasand hai. - I like tea.)

when_to_say: to refer to a hot beverage
example: वह कॉफी पीता है। (Vah kafi peeta hai. - He drinks coffee.)

when_to_say: to refer to a written work or publication
example: मैं पुस्तक पढ़ता हूँ। (Main pustak padhta hoon. - I read a book.)

when_to_say: to refer to a writing instrument
example: मैं कलम से लिखता हूँ। (Main kalam se likhta hoon. - I write with a pen.)

when_to_say: to refer to a material used for writing or printing
example: मैं कागज़ पर लिखता हूँ। (Main kagaz par likhta hoon. - I write on paper.)

when_to_say: to refer to a portable phone device
example: मैं मोबाइल पर बात करता हूँ। (Main mobile par baat karta hoon. - I talk on the mobile phone.)

when_to_say: to refer to an electronic device for processing data
example: मैं कंप्यूटर पर काम करता हूँ। (Main computer par kaam karta hoon. - I work on the computer.)

when_to_say: to refer to a global network of computers
example: मैं इंटरनेट पर सर्च करता हूँ। (Main internet par search karta hoon. - I search on the internet.)

when_to_say: to refer to a motor vehicle
example: मैं कार चलाता हूँ। (Main kaar chalaata hoon. - I drive a car.)

when_to_say: to refer to a large vehicle for transporting people
example: मैं बस से जाता हूँ। (Main bas se jaata hoon. - I go by bus.)

when_to_say: to refer to a railway vehicle
example: मैं ट्रेन से जाता हूँ। (Main train se jaata hoon. - I go by train.)

when_to_say: to refer to an aircraft
example: मैं हवाई जहाज़ से जाता हूँ। (Main havai jahaaz se jaata hoon. - I go by airplane.)

when_to_say: to refer to a place where sick people are treated
example: मैं दवाखाने जाता हूँ। (Main dawakhane jaata hoon. - I go to the hospital.)

when_to_say: to refer to a person who practices medicine
example: डॉक्टर ने मुझे दवा दी। (Doctor ne mujhe dava di. - The doctor gave me medicine.)

when_to_say: to refer to a person who cares for the sick or injured
example: नर्स ने मुझे इंजेक्शन लगाया। (Nurse ne mujhe injection lagaya. - The nurse gave me an injection.)

when_to_say: to refer to the law enforcement agency
example: पुलिस ने चोर को पकड़ा। (Pulis ne chor ko pakda. - The police caught the thief.)

when_to_say: to refer to a person who teaches
example: अध्यापक ने हमें पढ़ाया। (Adhyapaka ne hamein padhaya. - The teacher taught us.)

when_to_say: to refer to a person who studies
example: छात्र पढ़ रहा है। (Chhaatr padh raha hai. - The student is studying.)

when_to_say: to refer to a place where books are kept
example: मैं किताबखाने जाता हूँ। (Main kitabkhane jaata hoon. - I go to the library.)

when_to_say: to refer to a public area with plants and trees
example: हम पार्क में खेलते हैं। (Ham park mein khelte hain. - We play in the park.)

when_to_say: to refer to a natural flowing watercourse
example: नदी का पानी साफ है। (Nadi ka paani saaf hai. - The river water is clean.)

when_to_say: to refer to a large body of saltwater
example: समुद्र का पानी खारा है। (Samudra ka paani khara hai. - The sea water is salty.)

when_to_say: to refer to a large natural elevation of the earth's surface
example: पहाड़ बहुत ऊँचा है। (Pahaad bahut uncha hai. - The mountain is very high.)

when_to_say: to refer to a large area covered with trees and plants
example: जंगल में बहुत पेड़ हैं। (Jungle mein bahut ped hain. - There are many trees in the forest.)

when_to_say: to refer to a woody plant
example: पेड़ हरा होता है। (Ped hara hota hai. - The tree is green.)

when_to_say: to refer to the reproductive part of a plant
example: फूल सुंदर होता है। (Phool sundar hota hai. - The flower is beautiful.)

when_to_say: to refer to a flat, green part of a plant
example: पत्ती हरी होती है। (Patti hari hoti hai. - The leaf is green.)

when_to_say: to refer to the ripened seed-bearing part of a plant
example: फल मीठा होता है। (Phal meetha hota hai. - The fruit is sweet.)

when_to_say: to refer to a plant or part of a plant that is eaten as food
example: सब्जी स्वस्थ होती है। (Sabzi swasth hoti hai. - Vegetables are healthy.)

when_to_say: to refer to a white liquid produced by mammals
example: दूध पौष्टिक होता है। (Doodh poushtik hota hai. - Milk is nutritious.)

when_to_say: to refer to an oval object produced by birds
example: अंडा स्वादिष्ट होता है। (Anda swadisht hota hai. - Eggs are tasty.)

when_to_say: to refer to the star at the center of the solar system
example: सूर्य चमकता है। (Soorya chamakta hai. - The sun shines.)

when_to_say: to refer to the Earth's natural satellite
example: चंद्रमा चमकता है। (Chandrama chamakta hai. - The moon shines.)

when_to_say: to refer to a celestial body that emits light
example: आकाश में तारे चमकते हैं। (Aakash mein taare chamakte hain. - Stars shine in the sky.)

when_to_say: to refer to the expanse above the Earth's surface
example: आकाश नीला है। (Aakash nila hai. - The sky is blue.)

when_to_say: to refer to a liquid substance
example: पानी पीना चाहिए। (Paani peena chahiye. - One should drink water.)

when_to_say: to refer to the invisible gaseous substance surrounding the Earth
example: हवा चल रही है। (Hawa chal rahi hai. - The wind is blowing.)

when_to_say: to refer to the falling of water droplets from the sky
example: बरसात हो रही है। (Barsaat ho rahi hai. - It is raining.)

when_to_say: to refer to a low temperature
example: ठंड का मौसम है। (Thand ka mausam hai. - It is cold weather.)

when_to_say: to refer to a high temperature
example: गर्मी का मौसम है। (Garmi ka mausam hai. - It is hot weather.)

when_to_say: to refer to a sickness or illness
example: रोग से बचो। (Rog se bacho. - Avoid disease.)

when_to_say: to refer to the state of being healthy
example: स्वास्थ्य अच्छा होना चाहिए। (Swaasthya accha hona chahiye. - Health should be good.)

when_to_say: to refer to the physical structure of a person
example: शरीर स्वस्थ रखो। (Shariir swasth rakho. - Keep the body healthy.)

when_to_say: to refer to the faculty of thought and reason
example: मन शांत रखो। (Man shant rakho. - Keep the mind calm.)

when_to_say: to refer to the organ that pumps blood
example: दिल साफ रखो। (Dil saaf rakho. - Keep the heart pure.)

when_to_say: to refer to the organ of sight
example: आँखें बंद करो। (Aankhen band karo. - Close your eyes.)

when_to_say: to refer to the organ of hearing
example: कान खोलकर सुनो। (Kaan kholakar suno. - Listen carefully.)

when_to_say: to refer to the organ of smell
example: नाक से सूँघो। (Naak se sungho. - Smell with your nose.)

when_to_say: to refer to the opening through which food is taken in
example: मुँह बंद करो। (Muh band karo. - Close your mouth.)

when_to_say: to refer to the upper limb of a person
example: हाथ उठाओ। (Haath uthao. - Raise your hand.)

when_to_say: to refer to the lower limb of a person
example: पैर धोओ। (Pair dho. - Wash your feet.)

when_to_say: to refer to the upper part of the human body
example: सिर दर्द हो रहा है। (Sir dard ho raha hai. - My head hurts.)

when_to_say: to refer to the front part of the human head
example: चेहरा धोओ। (Chehra dho. - Wash your face.)

when_to_say: to refer to a material used for clothing
example: कपड़ा धो लो। (Kapda dho lo. - Wash the clothes.)

when_to_say: to refer to a covering for the foot
example: जूता पहनो। (Juta pahno. - Wear shoes.)

when_to_say: to refer to a covering for the foot
example: मोज़ा पहनो। (Moza pahno. - Wear socks.)

when_to_say: to refer to a covering for the head
example: टोपी पहनो। (Topi pahno. - Wear a hat.)

when_to_say: to refer to a device for measuring time
example: घड़ी देखो। (Ghadi dekho. - Look at the watch.)

when_to_say: to refer to a portable phone device
example: मोबाइल चार्ज करो। (Mobile charge karo. - Charge the mobile.)

when_to_say: to refer to a device for opening locks
example: चाबी खो गई। (Chabi kho gayi. - The key is lost.)

when_to_say: to refer to a writing instrument
example: पेंसिल तेज करो। (Pencil tej karo. - Sharpen the pencil.)

when_to_say: to refer to a device for taking photographs
example: कैमरा चलाओ। (Camera chalao. - Operate the camera.)

when_to_say: to refer to a written work or publication
example: किताब पढ़ो। (Kitab padho. - Read the book.)

when_to_say: to refer to a material used for writing or printing
example: कागज़ पर लिखो। (Kagaz par likho. - Write on the paper.)

when_to_say: to refer to a writing instrument
example: पेन से लिखो। (Pen se likho. - Write with a pen.)

when_to_say: to refer to an electronic device for processing data
example: कंप्यूटर चलाओ। (Computer chalao. - Operate the computer.)

when_to_say: to refer to an electronic device for watching programs
example: टेलीविज़न देखो। (Television dekho. - Watch television.)

when_to_say: to refer to a device for listening to broadcasts
example: रेडियो सुनो। (Radio suno. - Listen to the radio.)

when_to_say: to refer to a device for storing food at low temperatures
example: फ्रिज खोलो। (Frij kholo. - Open the refrigerator.)

when_to_say: to refer to something that is eaten
example: खाना खाओ। (Khana khao. - Eat food.)

when_to_say: to refer to a liquid substance
example: पानी पीओ। (Paani pio. - Drink water.)

when_to_say: to refer to a hot beverage
example: चाय पीओ। (Chai pio. - Drink tea.)

when_to_say: to refer to a hot beverage
example: कॉफी पीओ। (Kafi pio. - Drink coffee.)

when_to_say: to refer to a white liquid produced by mammals
example: दूध पीओ। (Doodh pio. - Drink milk.)

when_to_say: to refer to a flat baked food
example: रोटी खाओ। (Roti khao. - Eat bread.)

when_to_say: to refer to a type of grain
example: चावल खाओ। (Chawal khao. - Eat rice.)

when_to_say: to refer to a type of legume
example: दाल खाओ। (Daal khao. - Eat lentils.)

when_to_say: to refer to a plant or part of a plant that is eaten as food
example: सब्जी खाओ। (Sabzi khao. - Eat vegetables.)

when_to_say: to refer to the ripened seed-bearing part of a plant
example: फल खाओ। (Phal khao. - Eat fruit.)

when_to_say: to refer to a sweet dish
example: मिठाई खाओ। (Mithai khao. - Eat sweets.)

when_to_say: to refer to a utensil used for eating
example: चम्मच से खाओ। (Chammach se khao. - Eat with a spoon.)

when_to_say: to refer to a utensil used for eating
example: कांटे से खाओ। (Kaante se khao. - Eat with a fork.)

when_to_say: to refer to a sharp instrument used for cutting
example: छुरी से काटो। (Churi se kaato. - Cut with a knife.)

when_to_say: to refer to a flat dish used for serving food
example: प्लेट में रखो। (Plate mein rakho. - Put it on the plate.)

when_to_say: to refer to a container for drinking
example: गिलास में पानी डालो। (Gilaas mein paani daalo. - Pour water into the glass.)

when_to_say: to describe something positive
example: यह किताब अच्छी है। (Yah kitab achchi hai. - This book is good.)

when_to_say: to describe something negative
example: वह आदमी बुरा है। (Vah aadmi bura hai. - That man is bad.)

when_to_say: to describe something large in size
example: घर बड़ा है। (Ghar bada hai. - The house is big.)

when_to_say: to describe something small in size
example: बिल्ली छोटी है। (Billi chhoti hai. - The cat is small.)

when_to_say: to describe something long in length
example: सड़क लम्बी है। (Sadak lambi hai. - The road is long.)

when_to_say: to describe something short in length
example: पेड़ छोटा है। (Ped chhota hai. - The tree is short.)

when_to_say: to describe something pleasing to the eye
example: फूल सुंदर है। (Phool sundar hai. - The flower is beautiful.)

when_to_say: to describe something of a dark color
example: बिल्ली काली है। (Billi kaali hai. - The cat is black.)

when_to_say: to describe something of a light color
example: कमरा सफेद है। (Kamra safed hai. - The room is white.)

when_to_say: to describe something of a red color
example: टमाटर लाल है। (Tamatar laal hai. - The tomato is red.)

when_to_say: to describe something of a green color
example: पेड़ हरा है। (Ped hara hai. - The tree is green.)

when_to_say: to describe something of a blue color
example: आकाश नीला है। (Aakash neela hai. - The sky is blue.)

when_to_say: to describe something of a yellow color
example: केला पीला है। (Kela peela hai. - The banana is yellow.)

when_to_say: to express obligation or necessity
example: तुम्हें जाना चाहिए। (Tumhen jaana chahiye. - You should go.)

when_to_say: to express desire or wish
example: मैं जाना चाहता हूँ। (Main jaana chahta hoon. - I want to go.)

when_to_say: to express the action of reading
example: वह किताब पढ़ रहा है। (Vah kitab padh raha hai. - He is reading a book.)

when_to_say: to express the action of writing
example: मैं पत्र लिख रहा हूँ। (Main patra likh raha hoon. - I am writing a letter.)

when_to_say: to express the action of speaking
example: वे हिंदी बोल रहे हैं। (Ve Hindi bol rahe hain. - They are speaking Hindi.)

when_to_say: to express the action of listening
example: मैं गाना सुन रहा हूँ। (Main gaana sun raha hoon. - I am listening to a song.)

when_to_say: to express the action of seeing
example: मैं फिल्म देख रहा हूँ। (Main film dekh raha hoon. - I am watching a movie.)

when_to_say: to express the action of doing something
example: तुम्हें क्या करना है? (Tumhen kya karna hai? - What do you have to do?)

when_to_say: to express the action of going somewhere
example: मैं स्कूल जा रहा हूँ। (Main school ja raha hoon. - I am going to school.)

when_to_say: to express the action of coming somewhere
example: वह कल आएगा। (Vah kal aayega. - He will come tomorrow.)

when_to_say: to express existence or state of being
example: वह डॉक्टर है। (Vah doctor hai. - He is a doctor.)

when_to_say: to express the action of taking something
example: मैं किताब ले लूँगा। (Main kitab le loonga. - I will take the book.)

when_to_say: to express the action of giving something
example: मुझे पेन दो। (Mujhe pen do. - Give me the pen.)

when_to_say: to express the action of purchasing something
example: मैं बाजार से किताब खरीदूंगा। (Main bazaar se kitab khareeduga. - I will buy a book from the market.)

when_to_say: to express the action of selling something
example: दुकानदार किताबें बेचता है। (Dukanadar kitaaben bechta hai. - The shopkeeper sells books.)

when_to_say: to express the action of eating food
example: हम रात को खाना खाते हैं। (Ham raat ko khana khate hain. - We eat dinner at night.)

when_to_say: to express the action of drinking liquid
example: मैं पानी पीता हूँ। (Main paani peeta hoon. - I drink water.)

when_to_say: to express the action of sleeping
example: रात को सोना चाहिए। (Raat ko sona chahiye. - One should sleep at night.)

when_to_say: to express the action of waking up
example: सुबह जल्दी उठो। (Subah jaldi utho. - Wake up early in the morning.)

when_to_say: to express the action of sitting
example: कृपया बैठिए। (Kripya baithie. - Please sit down.)

when_to_say: to express the action of standing up
example: खड़ा हो जाओ। (Khada ho jao. - Stand up.)

when_to_say: to express the action of walking
example: रोज़ सुबह चलना चाहिए। (Roz subah chalna chahiye. - One should walk every morning.)

when_to_say: to express the action of running
example: सुबह दौड़ो। (Subah daudo. - Run in the morning.)

when_to_say: to express the action of jumping
example: ऊपर कूदो। (Upar kudo. - Jump up.)

when_to_say: to express the action of laughing
example: ज़ोर से हंसो। (Zor se hanso. - Laugh loudly.)

when_to_say: to express the action of crying
example: मत रोओ। (Mat ro. - Don't cry.)

when_to_say: to express the action of thinking
example: ज़्यादा मत सोचो। (Zyada mat socho. - Don't think too much.)

when_to_say: to express the action of remembering something
example: मुझे याद करो। (Mujhe yaad karo. - Remember me.)

when_to_say: to express the action of forgetting something
example: मत भूलना। (Mat bhoolna. - Don't forget.)

when_to_say: to express the action of learning something
example: हर दिन कुछ नया सीखो। (Har din kuchh naya seekho. - Learn something new every day.)

when_to_say: to express the action of meeting someone
example: कल हम मिलेंगे। (Kal ham milenge. - We will meet tomorrow.)

when_to_say: to express the action of talking to someone
example: हम फोन पर बात करेंगे। (Ham phone par baat karenge. - We will talk on the phone.)

when_to_say: to express the action of writing something
example: मैं पत्र लिख रहा हूँ। (Main patra likh raha hoon. - I am writing a letter.)

when_to_say: to express the action of reading something
example: वह किताब पढ़ रहा है। (Vah kitab padh raha hai. - He is reading a book.)

when_to_say: to express the action of seeing something
example: मैं फिल्म देख रहा हूँ। (Main film dekh raha hoon. - I am watching a movie.)

when_to_say: to express the action of listening to something
example: मैं गाना सुन रहा हूँ। (Main gaana sun raha hoon. - I am listening to a song.)

when_to_say: to express the action of doing something
example: तुम्हें क्या करना है? (Tumhen kya karna hai? - What do you have to do?)

when_to_say: to express the action of going somewhere
example: मैं स्कूल जा रहा हूँ। (Main school ja raha hoon. - I am going to school.)

when_to_say: to express the action of coming somewhere
example: वह कल आएगा। (Vah kal aayega. - He will come tomorrow.)

when_to_say: to express existence or state of being
example: वह डॉक्टर है। (Vah doctor hai. - He is a doctor.)

when_to_say: to express the action of taking something
example: मैं किताब ले लूँगा। (Main kitab le loonga. - I will take the book.)

when_to_say: to express the action of giving something
example: मुझे पेन दो। (Mujhe pen do. - Give me the pen.)

when_to_say: to express obligation or necessity
example: तुम्हें जाना चाहिए। (Tumhen jaana chahiye. - You should go.)

when_to_say: to express desire or wish
example: मैं जाना चाहता हूँ। (Main jaana chahta hoon. - I want to go.)

when_to_say: to express the action of reading
example: वह किताब पढ़ रहा है। (Vah kitab padh raha hai. - He is reading a book.)

when_to_say: to express the action of writing
example: मैं पत्र लिख रहा हूँ। (Main patra likh raha hoon. - I am writing a letter.)

when_to_say: to express the action of speaking
example: वे हिंदी बोल रहे हैं। (Ve Hindi bol rahe hain. - They are speaking Hindi.)
